name: Asian Salmon Wrap
author: Emily
summary: Moving around a lot, I find that cities often do not share the same restaurants. I lived in Seattle for a few years, and am now in Pensacola, FL. I missed the Samurai Salmon Wrap from World Wrapps. This is my effort for re-creating this taste sensation. It's a wrap with a fabulous Japanese-Asian flavor and a blend of textures to savor.
ingredients: ⅓ cup thinly julienned daikon radish
directions: Toss together the green onion, daikon radish, and cucumber in a small bowl
In a separate bowl, whisk together the rice wine vinegar, soy sauce, wasabi paste, and ground ginger
Lay to two tortillas onto a flat surface
Divide the rice and place in the center of each tortilla
Top each portion of rice with half of the salmon and half of the vegetable mixture
Drizzle half of the soy sauce mixture over each portion of vegetables
Sprinkle each with 1 teaspoon sesame seeds
Wrap the edges of the tortillas around the filling completely to serve
